key_events.description: GARE11 sold 10 properties leased to Grupo Pão de Açúcar and Grupo Matheus.

key_events.event_name: Acquisition of Parque Logístico de Confins
key_events.description: GARE11 acquired Parque Logístico de Confins with tenants including Mercado Livre, Vale, and Três Corações, yielding over 10% per year for the first 60 months.

key_events.event_name: Acquisition of Office Building in Belo Horizonte
key_events.description: GARE11 acquired an office building in Belo Horizonte fully leased to MRV, LOG CP, and Urba, with a cap rate of approximately 10.7% per year for the first 5 years.
Latest dividend announced was R$ 0.083 per share, with an annual dividend of 1.00 BRL per share, yielding 11.34%.
The 7th issuance was concluded with 141,728,215 shares at R$ 9.00, reaching R$ 9.01 considering the unit cost of distribution.

key_events.event_name: Acquisition of Commercial Properties in Rio Grande do Sul
key_events.description: Acquisition of two commercial properties in Rio Grande do Sul at a cap rate of 10.20%.

risk_factors: Market fluctuations may impact property values.

investment_thesis.bull_case: Acquisitions of Parque Logístico de Confins and the office building in Belo Horizonte, coupled with high cap rates (10.7% and 10.20% respectively) and a dividend yield of 11.34%, suggest strong potential returns.
investment_thesis.bear_case: No specific physical or financial vacancy percentages were found in the search results for 2026.

summary_markdown: GARE11's recent activities include the sale of 10 properties leased to Grupo Pão de Açúcar and Grupo Matheus. Simultaneously, GARE11 acquired Parque Logístico de Confins with tenants including Mercado Livre, Vale, and Três Corações, boasting a yield averaging over 10% per year for the first 60 months. Additionally, an office building in Belo Horizonte was acquired, fully leased to MRV, LOG CP, and Urba, with a cap rate of approximately 10.7% per year for the first 5 years. Two commercial properties in Rio Grande do Sul were acquired at a cap rate of 10.20%. The latest dividend announced was R$ 0.083 per share, translating to an annual dividend of 1.00 BRL per share and an 11.34% yield. The 7th issuance concluded with 141,728,215 shares at R$ 9.00 (R$ 9.01 with distribution costs).
